title: Getting Started with clinTrialData
text: clinTrialData community-grown library clinical trial example datasets R. package ships core set studies designed expand time — anyone can contribute new data source, users can download available study demand without waiting new package release. Data stored Parquet format accessed connector package, giving consistent API regardless study working . Key features: Growing library: New datasets added community GitHub Release assets — CRAN resubmission needed -demand download: Use download_study() fetch available study cache locally Generic interface: Use connect_clinical_data() connect available data source Automatic discovery: list_data_sources() finds studies machine; list_available_studies() shows everything available download Data protection: Downloaded bundled datasets locked accidental modification

title: Getting Started with clinTrialData
code: # Install from CRAN install.packages("clinTrialData")  # Or the development version from GitHub: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("Lovemore-Gakava/clinTrialData")

title: Getting Started with clinTrialData
code: library(clinTrialData)  # Studies on your machine (bundled + previously downloaded) list_data_sources() #>        source          description    domains  format location #> 1 cdisc_pilot CDISC Pilot 01 Study adam, sdtm parquet  bundled

title: Getting Started with clinTrialData
code: # What's on your machine already? list_data_sources()  # What's available to download from GitHub Releases? list_available_studies()  # Download a study once — cached locally from then on download_study("cdisc_pilot")  # Where is the cache? cache_dir()

title: Getting Started with clinTrialData
code: # Connect to CDISC Pilot data (or any available source) db <- connect_clinical_data("cdisc_pilot")  # List available datasets in ADaM domain db$adam$list_content_cnt()  # Read ADSL dataset adsl <- db$adam$read_cnt("adsl") head(adsl)

title: Getting Started with clinTrialData
code: # Get dataset dimensions dim(adsl)  # View structure str(adsl)  # Summary statistics summary(adsl)

title: Getting Started with clinTrialData
code: # Read adverse events data adae <- db$adam$read_cnt("adae")  # Read lab data adlbc <- db$adam$read_cnt("adlbc")

title: Getting Started with clinTrialData
code: # Read demographics dm <- db$sdtm$read_cnt("dm")  # Read vital signs vs <- db$sdtm$read_cnt("vs")

title: Getting Started with clinTrialData
text: package automatically discovers available data sources. can easily switch different sources work multiple sources simultaneously:
code: # Get information about all sources all_sources <- list_data_sources()  # Connect to different sources for (source_name in all_sources$source) {   cat("Connecting to:", source_name, "\n")   db <- connect_clinical_data(source_name)    # List domains available in this source   cat("Available domains:", names(db), "\n") }

title: Getting Started with clinTrialData
code: library(dplyr)  # Connect to data source db <- connect_clinical_data("cdisc_pilot")  # Read subject-level data adsl <- db$adam$read_cnt("adsl")  # Basic demographic summary by treatment demo_summary <- adsl %>%   group_by(TRT01A) %>%   summarise(     n = n(),     mean_age = mean(AGE, na.rm = TRUE),     female_pct = mean(SEX == "F", na.rm = TRUE) * 100,     .groups = "drop"   )  print(demo_summary)

title: Getting Started with clinTrialData
text: Anyone can add new study library. Datasets live GitHub Releases, inside package — pull request CRAN submission needed add data.

title: Getting Started with clinTrialData
text: Organise Parquet files domain:
code: your_new_study/ ├── adam/ │   ├── adsl.parquet │   └── adae.parquet └── sdtm/     ├── dm.parquet     └── ae.parquet

what: Step 2: Upload data and metadata to a GitHub Release
title: Getting Started with clinTrialData
text: Open issue request release slot, use helper script:
code: source("data-raw/upload_to_release.R")  # Upload the data zip upload_study_to_release("your_new_study", tag = "v1.1.0")  # Generate and upload metadata (enables dataset_info() for your study) generate_and_upload_metadata(   source      = "your_new_study",   description = "Brief description of your study",   version     = "v1.1.0",   license     = "Your license here",   source_url  = "https://link-to-original-data",   tag         = "v1.1.0" )

what: Step 3: Users can inspect and access it immediately
title: Getting Started with clinTrialData
text: CRAN submission required. study available users soon uploaded.
code: dataset_info("your_new_study")       # inspect before downloading download_study("your_new_study")     # download and cache connect_clinical_data("your_new_study")

title: Authors and Citation
text: Lovemore Gakava. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Gakava L (2026). clinTrialData: Clinical Trial Example Datasets. R package version 0.1.0, https://lovemore-gakava.github.io/clinTrialData/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {clinTrialData: Clinical Trial Example Datasets},   author = {Lovemore Gakava},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://lovemore-gakava.github.io/clinTrialData/}, }

title: Clinical Trial Example Datasets
text: clinTrialData community-grown library clinical trial example datasets R. package ships core set datasets designed expand time — anyone can contribute new data source, users can download available study demand without waiting new package release. Data stored Parquet format accessed connector package, giving consistent API regardless study working .

title: Clinical Trial Example Datasets
text: core idea simple: datasets live assets GitHub Releases, inside package . means: Users can pull study single function call Contributors can add new datasets without CRAN resubmission library expands community adds real-world clinical trial examples
code: # What's available to download from GitHub Releases? list_available_studies() #>                  source version size_mb cached #> 1           cdisc_pilot  v0.1.0     3.7   TRUE #> 2  cdisc_pilot_extended  v0.1.0     4.3  FALSE  # Inspect any study before downloading — fetches a tiny metadata file dataset_info("cdisc_pilot_extended") #> ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> cdisc_pilot_extended (v0.1.0) #> ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Enhanced CDISC Pilot 01 study with urinalysis data #> #> Domains & datasets: #>   adam   (12): adsl, adae, adlb, adlbc, adlbh, adlbhy, adlburi, ... #>   sdtm   (22): ae, cm, dm, ds, ex, lb, mh, qs, relrec, sc, ... #> #> Subjects:   254 #> Version:    v0.1.0 #> License:    CDISC Pilot — educational use #> Source:     https://github.com/cdisc-org/sdtm-adam-pilot-project #> ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────  # Download once; cached locally from then on download_study("cdisc_pilot_extended")  # Connect and analyse — same API for every study db <- connect_clinical_data("cdisc_pilot_extended") adsl <- db$adam$read_cnt("adsl")

title: Clinical Trial Example Datasets
code: # Install from CRAN install.packages("clinTrialData")  # Or the development version from GitHub: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("Lovemore-Gakava/clinTrialData")

title: Clinical Trial Example Datasets
code: library(clinTrialData)  # What's already on your machine? list_data_sources()  # What's available to download? list_available_studies()  # Download a study (only needed once — cached locally after that) download_study("cdisc_pilot")  # Connect and explore db <- connect_clinical_data("cdisc_pilot")  db$adam$list_content_cnt()  # list ADaM datasets db$sdtm$list_content_cnt()  # list SDTM datasets  adsl <- db$adam$read_cnt("adsl") dm   <- db$sdtm$read_cnt("dm")

title: Clinical Trial Example Datasets
text: cdisc_pilot — Standard CDISC Pilot 01 study (10 ADaM, 22 SDTM datasets). Available immediately installation, download needed.

title: Clinical Trial Example Datasets
text: cdisc_pilot_extended — Enhanced CDISC Pilot 01 study (11 ADaM, 24 SDTM datasets) additional features: TRTDURY — Treatment duration years ADLBURI — Urinalysis laboratory dataset ADLB — Combined labs including urinalysis Use list_data_sources() see locally available studies list_available_studies() see everything GitHub Releases.
code: download_study("cdisc_pilot_extended") connect_clinical_data("cdisc_pilot_extended")

title: Clinical Trial Example Datasets
text: Adding new study library require pull request CRAN submission. data lives GitHub Releases, inside package. Prepare data Parquet files organised domain (e.g. adam/, sdtm/): Upload GitHub Release — open issue repository request release slot, use helper script: Users can inspect access immediately — CRAN submission required:
code: your_study/ ├── adam/ │   ├── adsl.parquet │   └── adae.parquet └── sdtm/     ├── dm.parquet     └── ae.parquet source("data-raw/upload_to_release.R")  # Upload the data zip upload_study_to_release("your_study", tag = "v1.1.0")  # Generate and upload the metadata (enables dataset_info() for your study) generate_and_upload_metadata(   source      = "your_study",   description = "Brief description of your study",   version     = "v1.1.0",   license     = "Your license here",   source_url  = "https://link-to-original-data",   tag         = "v1.1.0" ) dataset_info("your_study")      # inspect before downloading download_study("your_study")    # download and cache connect_clinical_data("your_study")

title: Clinical Trial Example Datasets
text: datasets — whether bundled downloaded — automatically protected accidental modification. Reading always allowed; write delete operations blocked clear error message.

title: Clinical Trial Example Datasets
text: extended datasets derived CDISC Pilot Study data. Original Source: CDISC SDTM/ADaM Pilot Project Modifications: extended version includes additional derived variables (TRTDURY) simulated urinalysis dataset (ADLBURI) created educational development purposes. Acknowledgments: acknowledge thank CDISC making original pilot data available. extended datasets maintain structure quality original data adding features support additional analysis scenarios.

title: Clinical Trial Example Datasets
code: # Browse all vignettes vignette(package = "clinTrialData")  # Cache location cache_dir()

what: Get the Local Cache Directory — cache_dir
title: Get the Local Cache Directory — cache_dir
text: Returns path local cache directory downloaded clinical trial datasets stored. location follows platform-specific user data directory convention via tools::R_user_dir(). can delete subdirectory remove cached dataset, clear entire directory free disk space.

title: Get the Local Cache Directory — cache_dir
code: cache_dir()

title: Get the Local Cache Directory — cache_dir
text: character string path cache directory.

title: Get the Local Cache Directory — cache_dir
code: cache_dir() #> [1] "/home/runner/.cache/R/clinTrialData"

what: Check if study folder should be written — can_write_study
title: Check if study folder should be written — can_write_study
text: Helper function check study folder can safely written . Returns TRUE folder can written, FALSE locked. Issues warning folder locked.

title: Check if study folder should be written — can_write_study
code: can_write_study(study_path, operation = "write to study folder")

title: Check if study folder should be written — can_write_study
text: study_path Path study folder operation Description operation attempted

title: Check if study folder should be written — can_write_study
text: Logical indicating operation can proceed

title: Clinical Trial Datasets — clinTrialData-data
text: clinTrialData package contains clinical trial datasets multiple sources, stored Parquet format. Data accessed using connector functions.

title: Clinical Trial Datasets — clinTrialData-data
text: CDISC Pilot 01 Study Data Various clinical trial data sources

title: Clinical Trial Datasets — clinTrialData-data
text: CDISC Pilot 01 study data includes ADaM SDTM domains. ADaM datasets include: ADSL: Subject-Level Analysis Dataset ADAE: Adverse Events Analysis Dataset ADLB: Laboratory Analysis Dataset (combined) ADLBC: Laboratory Analysis Dataset (Chemistry) ADLBH: Laboratory Analysis Dataset (Hematology) ADLBHY: Laboratory Analysis Dataset (Hy's Law) ADLBURI: Laboratory Analysis Dataset (Urinalysis) SDTM datasets include: DM: Demographics AE: Adverse Events VS: Vital Signs LB: Laboratory Test Results

title: Clinical Trial Datasets — clinTrialData-data
text: Data sources discovered scanning package directory structure. List available datasets list_data_sources(). Access data using connection function:
code: # Connect to any data source (e.g., CDISC Pilot data) db <- connect_clinical_data("cdisc_pilot")  # List available datasets db$adam$list_content_cnt()  # Read a dataset adsl <- db$adam$read_cnt("adsl")  # See all available data sources list_data_sources()

title: Clinical Trial Datasets — clinTrialData-data
text: Datasets stored Parquet format: Columnar storage Fast reads Compression Cross-platform compatibility

title: Clinical Trial Datasets — clinTrialData-data
text: CDISC. Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium. https://www.cdisc.org/

what: Connect to Clinical Data by Source — connect_clinical_data
title: Connect to Clinical Data by Source — connect_clinical_data
text: Generic connection function allows access data source package. Data sources automatically discovered scanning package's example data directory structure.

title: Connect to Clinical Data by Source — connect_clinical_data
code: connect_clinical_data(source = "cdisc_pilot")

title: Connect to Clinical Data by Source — connect_clinical_data
text: source Character string specifying data source. Use list_data_sources() see available options.

title: Connect to Clinical Data by Source — connect_clinical_data
text: connectors object

title: Connect to Clinical Data by Source — connect_clinical_data
code: # \donttest{ # Connect to CDISC Pilot data db <- connect_clinical_data("cdisc_pilot") #> ℹ Replace some metadata informations... #> ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Connection to: #> → adam #> • connector_fs #> • /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/clinTrialData/exampledata/cdisc_pilot/adam #> ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Connection to: #> → sdtm #> • connector_fs #> • /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/clinTrialData/exampledata/cdisc_pilot/sdtm  # List available datasets db$adam$list_content_cnt() #>  [1] "adae.parquet"     "adlb.parquet"     "adlbc.parquet"    "adlbh.parquet"    #>  [5] "adlbhy.parquet"   "adqsadas.parquet" "adqscibc.parquet" "adqsnpix.parquet" #>  [9] "adsl.parquet"     "adtte.parquet"    "advs.parquet"      # Read a dataset adsl <- db$adam$read_cnt("adsl") #> → Found one file: /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/clinTrialData/exampledata/cdisc_pilot/adam/adsl.parquet  # List available sources list_data_sources() #>        source          description    domains  format location #> 1 cdisc_pilot CDISC Pilot 01 Study adam, sdtm parquet  bundled # }

title: Connect to Data Source — connect_to_source
text: Generic function connect data source scanning directory structure generating connector configuration dynamically. Wraps filesystem connectors lock protection. Resolution order: User cache (downloaded via download_study()) Package-bundled data (inst/exampledata/)

title: Connect to Data Source — connect_to_source
code: connect_to_source(source_name)

title: Connect to Data Source — connect_to_source
text: source_name Name data source (e.g., "cdisc_pilot")

title: Connect to Data Source — connect_to_source
text: connectors object

what: Inspect a Clinical Trial Dataset Without Downloading — dataset_info
title: Inspect a Clinical Trial Dataset Without Downloading — dataset_info
text: Fetches displays metadata study available clinTrialData library — without downloading full dataset. Metadata includes study description, available domains datasets, subject count, version, data source attribution. studies already downloaded via download_study(), metadata read local cache works offline. studies yet downloaded, small JSON file (~2KB) fetched GitHub Release.

title: Inspect a Clinical Trial Dataset Without Downloading — dataset_info
code: dataset_info(source, repo = "Lovemore-Gakava/clinTrialData")

title: Inspect a Clinical Trial Dataset Without Downloading — dataset_info
text: source Character string. Name study (e.g. "cdisc_pilot_extended"). Use list_available_studies() see options. repo GitHub repository form "owner/repo". Defaults official clinTrialData release repository.

title: Inspect a Clinical Trial Dataset Without Downloading — dataset_info
text: Invisibly returns metadata named list.

title: Inspect a Clinical Trial Dataset Without Downloading — dataset_info
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ dataset_info("cdisc_pilot_extended") } # }

title: Package onLoad hook — .onLoad
text: Called package loaded. Locks study folders installed package (development mode). Also registers S3 methods connector integration.

title: Package onLoad hook — .onLoad
code: .onLoad(libname, pkgname)

title: Package onLoad hook — .onLoad
text: libname Library name pkgname Package name

what: Download a Clinical Trial Study Dataset — download_study
title: Download a Clinical Trial Study Dataset — download_study
text: Downloads study dataset GitHub Release stores local cache (see cache_dir()). downloaded, study available connect_clinical_data() without internet connection. Requires piggyback package.

title: Download a Clinical Trial Study Dataset — download_study
code: download_study(   source,   version = "latest",   force = FALSE,   repo = "Lovemore-Gakava/clinTrialData" )

title: Download a Clinical Trial Study Dataset — download_study
text: source Character string. name study download (e.g. "cdisc_pilot"). Use list_available_studies() see options. version Character string. release tag download . Defaults "latest", resolves recent release. force Logical. TRUE, re-download even study already cached. Defaults FALSE. repo GitHub repository form "owner/repo". Defaults official clinTrialData release repository.

title: Download a Clinical Trial Study Dataset — download_study
text: Invisibly returns path cached study directory.

title: Download a Clinical Trial Study Dataset — download_study
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Download the CDISC Pilot study download_study("cdisc_pilot")  # Force re-download a specific version download_study("cdisc_pilot", version = "v1.0.0", force = TRUE)  # Then connect as usual db <- connect_clinical_data("cdisc_pilot") } # }

what: List Studies Available for Download — list_available_studies
title: List Studies Available for Download — list_available_studies
text: Returns data frame clinical trial studies available GitHub Release assets, along local cache status. Studies marked cached = TRUE already downloaded available use connect_clinical_data() without internet connection. Requires piggyback package.

title: List Studies Available for Download — list_available_studies
code: list_available_studies(repo = "Lovemore-Gakava/clinTrialData")

title: List Studies Available for Download — list_available_studies
text: repo GitHub repository form "owner/repo". Defaults official clinTrialData release repository.

title: List Studies Available for Download — list_available_studies
text: data frame columns: source Study name (pass download_study() connect_clinical_data()) version Release tag asset belongs size_mb Asset size megabytes cached TRUE study already local cache

title: List Studies Available for Download — list_available_studies
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ list_available_studies() } # }

what: List Available Clinical Data Sources — list_data_sources
title: List Available Clinical Data Sources — list_data_sources
text: Returns information clinical datasets available locally — datasets bundled package datasets previously downloaded via download_study(). location column indicates whether dataset "bundled" (shipped package) "cached" (downloaded user cache directory). see datasets available download GitHub, use list_available_studies().

title: List Available Clinical Data Sources — list_data_sources
code: list_data_sources()

title: List Available Clinical Data Sources — list_data_sources
text: data frame columns: source Dataset name (pass connect_clinical_data()) description Human-readable study description domains Comma-separated list available data domains (e.g. "adam, sdtm") format Storage format ("parquet") location Either "bundled" "cached"

title: List Available Clinical Data Sources — list_data_sources
code: list_data_sources() #>        source          description    domains  format location #> 1 cdisc_pilot CDISC Pilot 01 Study adam, sdtm parquet  bundled

title: Lock all study folders — lock_all_studies

title: Lock all study folders — lock_all_studies
text: Invisible list locked folders

what: Create a lock file for a study folder — lock_study
